definition: to share the same interests (idiom)/to be closely related/to be in the same boat
to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve

sentences.english: The ceramic tablewares have a bearing on human body.
sentences.chinese: 陶瓷食具是盛放食物的容器，与人体健康休戚相关。

sentences.english: And our community banks also have a stake in reform.
sentences.chinese: 我们的社区银行也与此休戚相关。

sentences.english: As is well known, a nation's development is closely related to state-society relations.
sentences.chinese: 国家发展成功与否和社会之关系是休戚相关的。

sentences.english: The Chinese people and other people of the third world are bound up by common interests and share weal and woe.
sentences.chinese: 中国人民和第三世界国家人民休戚相关，利害与共。

sentences.english: Encourage your associates to hold a stake in the company.
sentences.chinese: 鼓励你的同事们与公司荣辱与共，休戚相关。

sentences.english: Fate coexists with the survival of mankind and it rules the whole human life.
sentences.chinese: “命”与人类的生存休戚相关，统摄人类生活的全部。

sentences.english: I was living with total security pertaining to the world beyond this one.
sentences.chinese: 我生活在与另一个世界休戚相关的绝对安全感之中。

sentences.english: Madame Merle's interest was identical with Osmond's.
sentences.chinese: 梅尔夫人和奥斯蒙德是休戚相关的。

definition: (of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
lit. as close as lips and teeth (idiom); closely related/interdependent
to live or die/to exist or perish
one's own flesh and blood (idiom); closely related
prosperity and decline (of a kingdom)/rise and fall
lit. pull one hair and the whole body moves/fig. a slight change will affect everything else/the butterfly effect
pinyin: qian1 yi1 fa4 er2 dong4 quan2 shen1
